meanings.definition: Keep or restrict within certain limits.
meanings.sent1: Please confine your toys to the playroom.
meanings.sent2: It is important to confine the fire to the fireplace.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally confine my cat in the closet once.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of heights confined her to the ground.
meanings.sent5: The fence will confine the chickens in the yard.

meanings.definition: Restrict someone or something within certain limits.
meanings.sent1: We need to confine our discussion to the main topic.
meanings.sent2: The doctor advised him to confine his movements after surgery.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to confine the cat in a box.
meanings.sent4: His busy schedule confined him to his office most days.
meanings.sent5: The storm confined everyone indoors for safety.

meanings.sent1: The fence serves as a confine for the garden.
meanings.sent2: The confine of the park is marked by a stone wall.
meanings.sent3: The confine of the game is to stay within the board.
meanings.sent4: She felt the confine of her responsibilities weighing on her.
meanings.sent5: The confine of the river is where the two banks meet.
